elements.text: PART ONE
QO. EXT. KASTRIAN SURFACE/INT. KASTRIAN CITY
FX: DISTANT GALE FORCE WIND OF KASTRIAN SURFACE GIVES WAY TO
COLD AMBIENCE OF BARE CAVERNS AND EMPTY CITY INTERIOR
(V.O., RECITING OWN EPITAPH) “Here... lies... Eldrad.”
I am alive, but unliving.
I am in a thousand worlds.
Dead stone crushes me.
I crack in frozen waters.
I spin through empty space.
I blow in dust on the scourging winds.
Somewhere sea creatures cling and burrow through my body. In some places, I am unknown.
In others, I am forgotten.
A Doctor, curse his name, threw me down among the dead... But I endure.
FX: NOW, WE’RE WITH ACTUAL ELDRAD IN ?KASTRIAN HALL [SEE
LATER].
I am here — and a thousand places there. Upon my heart I carve this epitaph:
FX: SCRATCHES AGAINST STONE WITH A BLADE, SPEAKING AS HE
WRITES.
“T.. am... Eldrad.. and... I.. must... live!”
GRAMS: OPENING THEME
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 3
1. INT. HMS ALEXANDER — BRIDGE
FX: CLAXON REPEATING.

(INTO MIC) Mayday, mayday, mayday. This is Icebreaker Alexander, Alexander, Alexander. Mayday Alexander. Position: seventy-four, twenty-nine North; eleven, thirty-one West. Our nuclear reactor has been breached by a stowaway. We require immediate assistance. Sixty personnel are taking to lifeboats. Over.
FX: CROSS TO:
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 4
2. INT. HMS ALEXANDER — REACTOR DOOR
FX: CLAXON MORE DISTANT. CAPTAIN O’BRIEN PICKS UP PHONE
RECEIVER.
O’BRIEN

(BARELY CONTROLLED CALM) Gibbs. Gibbs. This is Captain O’Brien. Open the door. The nuclear core is close to meltdown. Come out of the reactor room. (BEAT) If you have demands, Gibbs, then make them known.
(FX: CLATTERING DOWN IRON STAIRS) Sir, the choppers are here!
O’BRIEN Then start the evacuation, Lieutenant.
Sir. (INTO RADIO) Wilson, commence evacuation. Science crew Lars:
O’BRIEN
(CALM AGAIN) Gibbs. My crew are evacuating. If this is a protest, it’s getting you nowhere. Get out of the reactor room. We have medics standing by.
FX: SERIES OF WARNING BUZZES.
Sir! She’s going critical! You can’t stay!
O’BRIEN Gibbs! Get out of there!
FX: ALARMS SUDDENLY DIE.
O’BRIEN What the devil?
The power’s down, sir!
FX: O’BRIEN BEATING FIST ON MASSIVELY HEAVY DOOR.
O’BRIEN Gibbs! Gibbs! Open the door.
FX: DOOR CLANKS AS ITS HEAVY LOCK ENGAGES.
He’s coming out.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) O’BRIEN
Keep back!
FX: THE DOOR OPENS.
(INTO RADIO) Medics, stand by! On my order.
O’BRIEN Wait!
BEAT.
O’BRIEN The reactor housing. It’s covered in ice.
Not ice, sir. More like quartz.
FX: SLOW FOOTSTEPS APPROACH.
(GROWL) El... drad...
O’BRIEN Gibbs? Is that you? .. Gibbs?
(SLOW REVELATION) Eldrad.. must...
His eyes, sir! They’re — I don’t know, glowing!
Eldrad... must... .. die!
FX: FIERCE ENERGY STABS FROM GIBBS’S EYES.
O’ BRIEN/ PARKER
OUT IN PAIN.
BEAT.
Bridgehead established. Eldrad must die.
O’ BRIEN/ PARKER (INTONE) Eldrad must die.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 6
3. INT. KATE SHERRIN’S RANGE ROVER (IN MOTION
KATE ON HER REGULAR DRIVE ALONG THE COAST ROUND AMBERMOUTH, CHECKING THE BEACH FOR DEAD GANNETS.
FX: CAR DRIVING ALONG COAST ROAD — DISTANT SEA. PHONE TRILLS.
IT’S HANDS-FREE. KATE ANSWERS.
Jim.
You finished yet?
Just up on the headland. Back in ten. Why? What’s the problem?
Skipper’s a bit restive. Probably misses Mummy.
Poor little mite. Give him an extra fish.
He’1ll love you for that. Anything to report?
Two more dead ones at the cove. All quiet elsewhere. Put the kettle on.
Will do.
(SEES DOCTOR & CO ON BEACH) Oh, hang on. What the...?
FX: CAR STOPS. HANDBRAKE ON.
Kate?
I don’t believe this. Three strollers on the beach. No, four of them. Casual as you like. Oh, what’s the point? Don’t these cretins ever read the notices?
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 7
4. EXT. AMBERMOUTH BEACH
FX: WAVES BREAKING GENTLY. OCCASIONAL SEAGULL.
Ooh, that’s better. Good to get the sand between my toes. Coming for a paddle, Doc?
Well... er... Why not?
Great! (TO NYSSA & TURLOUGH) And that goes for you two as well.
A paddle? Is that another Earth custom I’ve missed out on?
A particularly British custom, Nyssa.
Not just British.
Doesn’t it go with deckchairs and knotted handkerchiefs?
You do it your way, I’1ll do it mine. (SETTING OFF) Well, come on. Last one in’s a dingo’s dinner!
Wait, Tegan! (TAKING SHOES OFF) I have to take my shoes off first! (TO SELF) Why does she never wait?
FX: HE FOLLOWS.
You’ve studied ‘paddling’ extensively, have you, Turlough?
It was unavoidable. Half-term in rainy Weston with the Hippo family.
Right then. (TAKING SHOES OFF) Shoes off... Come on, Turlough.
It doesn’t mean we have to take part.
(DISTANT) Come on, you two!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 8
I don’t think we get the choice.
Yes, we do. There are rock pools over there. Let’s go and take
a look.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 9
5. EXT. BEACH — SEA’S EDGE [CONTINUOUS]
(STANDING IN WATER) Jeepers! The water’s cold.
EFFORT AS HE SKIMS A PEBBLE
FX: 5 x SPLASHES OF PEBBLE OVER WATER.
Hey! Mind where you’re chucking pebbles!
Yes! A fiver! Haven’t played ducks and drakes for years!
It’s so quiet. You’d think there’d be tourists.
It’s probably the off-season.
Maybe. How far to that island, do you think?
Too far to swim. (BEAT) Ever been surfing?
Me! Can you imagine? No thanks. I’d rather watch. How about you?
Not on the sea, no.
I won’t even ask. Nyssa and Turlough chickened out then.
That’s alright. Rock pools have a certain fascination.
You mean Turlough has an affinity with things that lurk under boulders?
I feel a Cornish seafood dinner coming on. There must be a village along the coast. (SPLASHES AWAY) Race you round the headland.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 10 (FX: SPLASHING FORWARD) Wait for [me!] — (FOOT ON GLASS) — Ouch!
(SPLASHING BACK) Tegan! Are you alright?
My foot. Cripes, the sand under here is really prickly.
Yes. I was thinking that.
It’s coarse. More like ground glass.
Maybe we should have kept our shoes on. Your foot’s bleeding.
Just a scratch.
Come on. Out of the water. Lean on me.
FX: THEY SPLASH ASHORE.
(WALKING AWKWARDLY) It’s okay. Look after yourself.
(SOME WAY OFF) Hey! You two!
Uh-oh. Someone’s on the warpath.
A slight exaggeration, Tegan.
(APPROACHING) What the hell do you think you’re doing?
Or maybe not. Good morning.
What’s with the camera?
I don’t think photos are necessary.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL)
Didn’t you see the signs? The beach is closed. You have to get
off now. It isn’t safe.
We found that out for ourselves.
FX: KATE ACTIVATES A GEIGER COUNTER. ITS CLICKING IS SLOW.
Please hold still.
Is that a Geiger counter?
It is. Is that why this beach is closed?
It’s radioactive!
You're both fine. The levels are way down.
You sound almost surprised. I’m the Doctor, by the way, this is Tegan.
I have to check. You’re clear.
Apart from Tegan’s foot.
What? Are you hurt?
Something in the sand cut me. It’s just a scratch.
Oh, you tourists never learn, do you! .. We’d better get
looked at. I’ve got a first aid kit in the car.
and
ze
Why is the beach closed? Because of radioactivity levels that
you say are safe?
Off, now! And your friends over there!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 12
6. EXT. BEACH — BY ROCK POOLS [CONTINUOUS]
FX: DISTANT SEA.
Like a metaphor, isn’t it?
A rock pool?
A group of creatures stranded when the tide goes out. And none of them happy to be stuck with each other.
They learn to get on. Look at these anemones. They’re so delicate.
And then someone big comes along and pokes them with a stick.
FX: HE SPLASHES THE POOL.
Don’t do that, Turlough. How would you like it?
We could pretend it’s educational. Who’s shallow... and who’s in deep? It’s fun to make them react.
Unless you’re on the sharp end of the stick.
Aren’t I always?
Less than you imagine.
BEAT
Hello, what’s that?
Where?
Something glittered.. There. Over there. By that crevice.
FX: HE STARTS MOVING FROM ROCK TO ROCK.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 13
Careful. The rocks are slippery.
Whoops. Ow!
FX: SKIDS DOWN A ROCK.
Turlough!
I’m fine. I’m fine. (CLIMBS UP) (SURPRISED) It’s a bird. A big one.
Hang on. Oops. Steady. (GAINING BALANCE) Oh, that’s better. It’s not moving.
It’s dead. Careful! Look at its wings. Its feathers are full of crystals.
Poor thing, it’s all encrusted. No wonder it died.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 14
7. EXT. COAST ROAD — BY KATE’S CAR [CONTINUOUS]
(FOOT TREATED) Ouch!
Sorry. The iodine stings, but it’1ll clean your scratch.
Thanks.
You’re welcome. (TESTY) So if you didn’t see the signs, how did you get to the beach? By boat?
Not exactly. We came in...
We walked along the beach at low tide. We didn’t know it was a private.
It isn’t. Not private. It’s just off-limits.
Who says?
Are you from the Press?
Why? Is there a story?
No comment.
So what’s with the Geiger counter?
It’s alright, Tegan. We’re just visitors out for a walk by the sea. Not snooping at all.
Then you’1l have nothing to worry about when I report you to the authorities.
You’re joking! Of all the Jobsworths...
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 15
Yes, thank you, Tegan! (TO KATE) I’m sorry. We didn’t catch your name.
Kate Sherrin. I run the Ambermouth Seacology Centre. Just round the headland.
Really? Local marine life, that sort of thing? How’s the over- fishing affecting you?
That’s just one of our problems. — (CATCHING SELF) Oh, no, no, no. I’m asking the questions, not you. Can you call your other friends back. please? Where are you staying?
We haven’t decided yet.
We don’t have to tell you anything.
(DISTANT) Doctor!
(CALLING) Turlough? Over here!
(DISTANT) Come and see! There’s something we’ve found.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL)
8. EXT. BEACH — BY ROCK POOLS [CONTINUOUS]
FX: WAVES BREAK.
Tegan was limping. Has she hurt herself?
Couldn’t say. She’s staying put. Who is that woman?
I don’t know. But the Doctor’s running to keep up.
(APPROACHING) What have you found? Please don’t touch
Turlough?
Down here. A dead bird.
Please stand clear. Right back.
Isn’t that a gannet?
From the colony on the island.
I assume the crystalline encrustation isn’t natural.
May I see?
No. Stand back.
anything.
FX: KATE’S GEIGER COUNTER STARTS UP AGAIN. SLOW CRACKLES.
It’s all through its wings.
FX: THE GEIGER COUNTER CRACKLES FIERCELY.
Silicon quartz... with a high radioactive reading.
I hope you didn’t touch it.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 17
Not really, no.
Sixty c.p.s.? That is high. Now what would cause that sort of contamination?
FX: GEIGER COUNTER OFF.
Wouldn’t the weight make it impossible to fly?
The whole thing should be impossible. (TO KATE) Has this happened before?
None of your business. Please, stand clear. I need to take pictures.
FX: KATE’S CAMERA CLICKS THROUGH:
That’s a yes, I take it? Kate, this is Nyssa and Turlough. We’d like to help.
The Doctor’s highly qualified.
What in?
Oh, you wouldn’t believe.
And I’m very discreet. But this needs studying.
BEAT
It’s a one-off. It needs to be looked at by experts.
He is an expert.
Kate, we’re not Press. You’re the only one taking pictures.
Do you have a car?
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL)
Not exactly.
No. Not a car.
FX: KATE PULLS A PLASTIC SACK FROM COAT POCKET.
Right. (STUFFING BIRD IN BAG) I’m bagging this bird
then I’m running you into the village.
It’s lucky that you’re so well-prepared.
With a Geiger counter, and special gloves.
FX: KATE CLOSES BAG.
It’s out of your league, alright? It’s classified.
Just a one-off occurrence then.
Exactly. And you never saw a thing.
up,
and
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 19
9. INT. BAR AT THE PESKADOR INN
GIBBS — QUITE POSH, A BIT LOUD, BUT DOWN ON HIS LUCK. HE’S ON HIS MOBILE TO A DODGY DEALER.
FX: MOBILE PHONE BIPS. BEAT FOR PICK-UP.
Hi. Is that ‘Rocco’?
Yeah. Charlie Gibbs. I texted about the item. Yeah, that’s right. And you’ve got it with you?
Great. I’m in the bar at The Peskador Inn at Ambermouth. Right on the quay.
Cool. So when can I expect you?
Are you ready to order, sir?
(INTO PHONE) Oh, hang on. —
(TO WAITRESS) Yeah, I’ll have the seafood lasagne, love. And pint of Old Scurvy. Thanks.
(BACK TO PHONE) Sorry ‘bout that. Where were we? Oh, yeah. So when will you get here?
Now hang on. You told me you’d deliver. Me coming to collect was not an option.
No, no. That’s not what we said.
FX: JUST OFF, ANNOYING ELECTRONIC TUNE FROM A FRUIT MACHINE
UP.
(CAN'T HEAR) What? Oh, no. Hang on. —
FX: HE PUSHES BACK HIS CHAIR. FOLLOW HIM AS MOVES AWAY.
Sorry about that. Some goons playing the fruit machine right next to me.
So, what are we gonna do about this? When do I get to see the item?
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL)
FX: CROSS BACK TO THE FRUIT MACHINE. IT TRILLS A LITTLE TUNE OF
AS CASH SPILLS OUT.
CUSTOMERS CHEER.
Brilliant. You hit the jackpot!
Lunch is on Nyssa, I think.
(LAUGHING) How did you do that? You have to
FX: NYSSA GATHERING UP HER WINNINGS.
have a system.
I observed the algorithmic responses of the machine to the last
three players. It’s all perfectly simple.
Remind me never to take you to Las Vegas.
I was thinking exactly the opposite.
Here, Tegan. Your one pound deposit.
Thanks. But you lost me at the first mention of algorithms.
There’s a table here.
Great. Fresh food that isn’t out of a machine for once. Graba
menu, Doctor.
FX: MUCH CHAIR PULLING AND SITTING DOWN.
At least Kate Sherrin didn’t report us.
Mrs Jobsworth? Budge up, Turlough.
Probably hoping we didn’t see the other bags car.
in the back of her
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 21
Two more dead gannets, I presume.
And more radioactive crystals. What could be causing that?
I don’t know.
Suddenly the local seafood is losing its appeal.
She said the colony was on the island.
What we need is a man with a boat.
But won’t the island be off-limits too?
[Possibly -]
(INTERRUPTING, SOTTO) Don’t turn around, but someone’s staring at us.
(HALF-TURNING) Really-?
(SOTTO) No, don’t look. Middle-aged bloke, too wide for his shirt?
(HALF-RECOGNISING) He seems... familiar.
He’s coming over.
Perhaps he’s after our winnings.
‘scuse me butting in, guys. This’1l sound crazy, but, uh —
What?
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 22
You, mate. No-one in your family named ‘Turlough’, is there? ‘Cos you’re the spitting image of a fella [I knew at sch—]
(INCREDULOUS) Gibbs? Charlie Gibbs?
Your Dad was ‘Vince’ Turlough, yeah? (THINKS: HOW’D HE KNOW?) Hang about, [how’d you —]
No, Gibbo. It is me. Vislor.
No. Can’t be.
This is amazing. It must be... oh...
Thirty years?
That long?
Since we were — No, it can’t be. You don’t look a day older.
Well, it is me. I promise you.
Incredible. (BEAT) So how are you, mate? You got expelled, that’s what they said.
I’m fine. I went ‘travelling.’
You still are.
Sorry, this is Tegan, Nyssa and the Doctor. Charlie and I were at Brendon together.
(AMUSED) Oh, one of your old school chums. Hi.
Hello.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 23
Yes, it’s good to meet
(TO TURLOUGH) Crazy. I Portrait in the attic,
Not exactly.
So.. are you staying in
Are we staying, Doctor?
Quite possibly.
Great.
FX: HIS MOBILE RINGS.
you, Charlie.
can’t get over it. You haven’t changed. right?
the area?
Oh, sorry. Business calls. Enjoy your lunch. Maybe we can catch
up over a drink later?
Old times, eh?
Yes. Yes, I'd like that.
(LEAVING) See you all later.
Cheerio.
BEAT
Well, that was embarrassing.
I’m assuming that since the TARDIS has neither an attic nor a portrait to go in it, he was making some sort of literary
illusion?
(UNNERVED) He’s never thumbed through a book in his life.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 24
His long life. All those years without his best mate, Turlough. (LAUGHING) Or a portrait of his own to stop the wrinkles. —
(IRRITATED) He was never my ‘best mate’.
He wasn’t-?
Charlie Gibbs was always trouble. And from the look of him, he still is.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 25
11. INT. IN GIBBS’S HEAD
FX: FADE UP CONTINUOUS JANGLE OF ENERGY, LIKE A LOW-LEVEL
VERSION OF THE STAB OF POWER WHEN GIBBS TOOK OVER THE ALEXANDER CREW.
(A DEEP, FEMALE KASTRIAN VOICE, AS YET UNNAMED SO THE LISTENERS
THINK IT’S THE FEMALE ELDRAD) Gibbs, you are a coward.
(IN GREAT DISCOMFORT) I told you. It’s arranged. I collect the Watcher tonight.
You are certain? It is the true Watcher?
You gave me the details.
FX: STAB OF POWER HOLDS GIBBS FOR SEVERAL MOMENTS.
GASPS IN PAIN UNDER MULKRIS’S SCRUTINY
FX: THE POWER RELENTS.
The Watcher will be dangerous. That fear sullies your thoughts.
You must not fail.
I won’t. It’s all sorted. You’1l get your item. No problem.
FX: ANOTHER TWO SECOND STAB OF POWER.
WINCES AGAIN
Ah... (LAUGHS) Very cunning, Gibbs. You plan not to handle the Watcher yourself.
Delegate responsibility. That’s what you have to do.
And your ‘Carrier’... is he trustworthy?
Oh, yeah. We go way back, me and old Vislor —
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 26
FX: JANGLE ENDS SHARPLY — AND WE CUT SUDDENLY TO:
11. EXT. QUAYSIDE
FX: WATER SLAPPING. SEAGULL CRIES.
(GASPS FOR AIR, THEN:) Yeah, Turlough’1ll do as he’s told. He owes me a favour or two, after all.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 27
12. INT. PUB (AT BAR
(APPROACHING A LOCAL) Excuse me. Is it Mr Gell?
Maybe. Who’s asking?
I’m the Doctor? How do you do?
Sounds important. Touting for business, are you?
Not exactly, no. (BEAT) The landlord says you have a boat.
Oho, he does, does he? Yes. I got a boat.
For hire, by any chance?
Fancy a spot of fishing, do you? You and your posh friends? From London, are you?
Not exactly.
Cos I wouldn’t waste your time.
Ah. The stocks are down, I take it. You’re fished out.
Chance’d be a fine thing. There ain’t no fish at all. Not now.
Why? What happened?
All died overnight. The harbour was floating thick with ‘em. The gulls were so fat they could hardly fly. And then most of them died too.
And the gannets?
Yep. Gannets, puffins...
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 28
With crystals growing through their feathers?
You from the telly?
Thankfully not. Sorry to disappoint you.
My livelihood, fishing was. My old dad and granddad and his too, they was all fishermen here.
What about the authorities? Have you had compensation?
There’1ll be ‘an Inquiry’, that’s what they says. We gets a weekly check-up on Thursdays. And free pills — potash ones. Horrible, they are.
Potassium iodate for radiation sickness?
Just in case, they says.
But surely people elsewhere must have noticed?
You put things on the interweb, and it’s headlines for a day, till the next celebrity scandal comes along. You know, all they offered us in compensation was...
Yes, yes. Times are obviously hard. I wanted a boat out to the island.
You’1l be lucky. I ain’t put out this past year. More like I never will again.
I’m sorry.
Boats go down round here.
Many boats?
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 29
Plenty. Even a couple of fighter jets.
Jets!
And nothing gets recovered. Not even their crews. My old Granddad, he used to say the water round Ambermouth was sweet. Not any more. Now, deep down, its heart’s gone bad.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL)
13. INT. PUB — AT TABLE
Your drinks.
FX: SETTING DOWN 4 x GLASSES.
Thanks very much.
Pleasure.
FX: SHE GOES.
Hope the food’s not long. cheers.
I’m starving.
FX: TURLOUGH STANDS.
Sorry. I can’t sit here.
Turlough? Are you alright?
I need some air.
FX: HE LEAVES.
That friend of his has upset him.
Well, how would you feel, meeting your heeby-jeebies too.
(RETURNING) That was instructive.
Any luck with the boat?
Not exactly. Where’s Turlough?
Gone to powder his nose...
He went for some
(RAISING GLASS) Well...
future? It’d give me the
air...
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 31
BEAT
Right. Only I thought he looked rather... peaky.
He’1ll be fine.
Course he will. You know Turlough.
That’s exactly what’s worrying me.
(BACK TO SUBJECT) The boat, Doctor?
No luck, I’m afraid. There’s something very wrong round here.
We already worked that one out.
This village has been sidelined. Something’s being covered up. Don’t drink that, Nyssa.
What?
FX: HE GRABS THE GLASS.
Careful!
FX: HE SPLOSHES THE DRINK ONTO THE FLOOR.
What are you doing? You’ve spilled it!
Look at the bottom of the glass.
A sort of sediment?
Not exactly. I hope you didn’t drink this.
No. No, I didn’t.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 32
It’s in mine too. What sort of joint is this? Waitress!
(STUDIES IT) These are silicon crystals — quartz.
Like the sand on the beach?
Very possibly. And they’re growing.
(COMING OVER) Is there a problem?
You bet there is. Forget the food. We’re eating elsewhere.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 33
14. EXT. QUAYSIDE
EXT. WATER SLAPPING. SEAGULLS.
(APPROACHING) Charlie?
I knew you’d follow me out. You’re missing your lunch.
I wasn’t hungry.
BEAT
You were always an odd one, Turlers. Even with all the other off-Earth weirdoes at Brendon.
Others? What others?
You never noticed? A proper little underground railroad, shuttling stateless exiles into safety.
Through that creepy solicitor on Chancery Lane? But I thought it was just me. All that time — (A THOUGHT) Hold on, you don’t mean you —
What do you think?
But you never said. Where are you from?
I’m from Trion, Turlough.
Trion!
Just like you.
Trion... But I never knew you. Where were you...?
I was on the other side in the war. Your lot weren’t the only ones who got persecuted and sold off.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 34
All that time, at Brendon, and no-one said...
Public school, Turlers. No-one says anything.
You’re right. That’s why I got out.
You think that was just chance? Not what I heard, matey.
I got away, didn’t I?
You reckon? Once you’re on the roster, you can run all you like. It’ll catch you up sometime.
Oh, no. That’s all behind me. I’ve got a new life now.
Sorry, Turlers. Your travelling days are over. You’ve got a job to do. (GRABBING HIM) Look at me!
Get off! — Ah!
FX: STAB OF PSYCHIC PAIN. REVERSE ECHO INTO:
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL)
14. INT. IN TURLOUGH’S HEAD
FX: JANGLING.
(ECHOING) Turlough...
Who are you? (BEAT) I said, who are you?!
(AS FROM OFF) Turlough? ...
FX: SHARP CUT BACK BACK TO:
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 36
15. EXT. QUAYSIDE
(‘WAKE UP!’) .. Turlough!
(SNAPPING OUT OF IT) Huh? Doctor...?
Your friend was in a hurry.
What, Charlie? Where is he?
Busy chap. Maybe he was called away.
Yes... maybe.
Are you alright? You look pale.
That’s normal for me.
Hmm.
BEAT
Sorry about lunch.
That’s alright. The service wasn’t up to much. (THRUSTING BAG OF CRISPS) I got you a bag of crisps instead.
(TAKING THEM) Oh.. thanks.

TURLOUGH: (THREAT) The Watcher.
GIBBS: Come on, Rocco. Friend Turlough’s getting anxious.
ROCCO: There’s a box in the glove compartment. Go on, take it.
TURLOUGH: It’s heavy.
ROCCO: Well, it’s lead-lined, isn’t it?
GIBBS: Go on, Turlers. Open it.
TURLOUGH: It’s an eye. Cut from crystal.
ROCCO: Quartz. Dunno how old it is.
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 86
ROCCO: It has this blue glow sometimes, yeah? Like it’s really watching.
MULKRIS: (IN TURLOUGH’S HEAD) The Watcher, Turlough!
ROCCO: Like it’s doing now, in fact...
MULKRIS: (IN TURLOUGH’S HEAD) Don’t look at the eye, Turlough! Close the box, and bring it to me. Bring it to me so that Eldrad can die!
GIBBS: (ENTRANCED BY EYE) It’s beautiful. So beautiful.
TURLOUGH: Don’t look at it. You mustn’t look at it!
GIBBS: (NOW IN THE EYE’S POWER — POSSESSED BY ELDRAD) But can’t you see? We’ve been wrong, all along. Eldrad must live. (MENACING) Hand over the box, Turlough.
TURLOUGH: No! I must take the Watcher so that Eldrad can die!
GIBBS: Give me the box! Eldrad must live!
ROCCO: What’s up with you two freaks-?
TURLOUGH: No! No! Eldrad must die!
GIBBS: Turlough... Come back here! Turlough!
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 87
MULKRIS: (IN TURLOUGH’S HEAD) Bring me the Eye. Bring me the Eye so that Eldrad can die!
TEGAN: (CALLING) Turlough! It’s me! Over here!
TURLOUGH: (CONFUSED) Deela...?
TEGAN: What’s that you’ve got there?
TURLOUGH: (BREATHLESS) Deela? I came to find you. I’ve got your data. I have to take it back.
GIBBS: (APPROACHING) Turlough! Get back here! Eldrad must live!
TEGAN: Not him again. Just get in, will you-?!
GIBBS: (STUMBLING TO STOP) No! No! (BREATHLESS) Eldrad must live!
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 88
NYSSA: We’re not getting any closer to the island.
DOCTOR: (EFFORT) I’m trying, Nyssa. It’s like rowing through porridge.
KATE: There’s no swell. The water’s almost... gooey.
DOCTOR: Don’t touch it, Kate!
NYSSA: It’s full of crystals. Like it’s freezing over.
KATE: It’s not that cold.
DOCTOR: It’s not ice. It’s the salts crystallising. And the silicon. This isn’t right.
KATE: I could have told you that.
GROWING: CRYSTALS.
DOCTOR: Uh! This is hopeless. We’re not moving at all!
NYSSA: The sea’s gone solid. We’re aground.
KATE: (INCREDULOUS) Well, we can’t just sit here!
DOCTOR: Why not? — Don’t get out of the dinghy. If they want me, they can come and get me.
KATE: They want you?
NYSSA: You're taking this very personally.
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 89
DOCTOR: (SHOUTING) Eldrad! Eldrad of Kastria! Are you there? Can you hear me?
KATE: (TO NYSSA) Is he actually safe to be with?
DOCTOR: (SHOUTING) It’s the Doctor! Remember me? I want a word with you!
NYSSA: Perhaps you’re wrong, Doctor. Perhaps it’s not Eldrad who’s doing this.
DOCTOR: All the clues are there. Of course it is. (SHOUTS) Eldrad!
KATE: What’s happening?
NYSSA: The sea’s splitting open!
KATE: There’s something underneath us! Something coming up!
KATE: OPEN AND A VAST CRYSTAL ICEBERG BURSTS THROUGH.
DOCTOR: (EXHILARATED) Look at that! Magnificent!
NYSSA: It’s an iceberg! A crystal iceberg!
DOCTOR: A quartz-berg! How high is it going, do you think? A hundred feet? A hundred and fifty?
KATE: This isn’t possible!
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 90
NYSSA: I think it’s stopped.
DOCTOR: Well, then — time we were going.
KATE: What are you doing? Don’t get out!
DOCTOR: Oh, the matrix in these crystals must be incredibly strong.
NYSSA: (STEPPING OUT) Quite thick enough to stand on — see?
KATE: You should both be certified.
NYSSA: Are you coming?
DOCTOR: Interesting. There’s something inside the berg, I think.
DOCTOR: Something big. —
NYSSA: I see what you mean. —
KATE: The crystal, it’s cracking! There’s something coming out!
CAPTAIN: O’BRIEN (OFF, VOICE DEEPENED) Stay where you are! Don’t move!
NYSSA: Not something. Someone.
DOCTOR: (CALLING) Who exactly am I addressing?
DOCTOR: O’BRIEN Captain O’Brien, HMS Alexander. I have come to bring you aboard!
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 91
DOCTOR WHO: O’BRIEN This way, please.
DOCTOR: (WALKING IN) Thank you... er, Captain.
KATE: (FOLLOWING) I don’t believe it. A ship in an iceberg!
NYSSA: (FOLLOWING) Quartzberg.
DOCTOR: This is an icebreaker — isn’t it, Captain? Only we’re a long
DOCTOR: way from the Arctic Circle...
DOCTOR: O’BRIEN This way.
KATE: Where is he taking us?
NYSSA: Kate, it’s alright.
KATE: It’s not alright. Look at his face.
DOCTOR: Well, he’s covered with crystal, just like the villagers.
KATE: Much more so. It’s all over him.
NYSSA: And those crewmen we saw.
NYSSA: O’BRIEN (TO STOP) Here we are, sir.
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 92
NYSSA: We’re outside.
DOCTOR: On the foredeck, I think. (SEES SOMETHING, STRIDING OVER) Only
DOCTOR: that doesn’t belong here!
KATE: (FOLLOWING) What is it? Some sort of weird submarine?
NYSSA: (FOLLOWING) More like an interstellar shuttle.
KATE: Interstellar?
NYSSA: Doctor, the hatchway!
DOCTOR: At last. Eldrad.
MULKRIS: (STEPPING OUT, BOOMING) Who spoke? Who spoke that name?
KATE: (SOTTO) What is that? It’s not even human.
NYSSA: (SOTTO) But she does seem female, Doctor.
DOCTOR: (SOTTO) Fifty-fifty chance. Keep back.
MULKRIS: You. The male human. (STOMPING OVER) You spoke that name!
DOCTOR: Eldrad-?
MULKRIS: Is Eldrad here? Are you in his thrall?
DOCTOR: You’re not Eldrad-?
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 93
MULKRIS: His name is accursed across the galaxy. Eldrad must die — and so must his slaves!
DOCTOR: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 94

You. The male human. (STOMPING OVER) You spoke that name!

46. EXT. FOREDECK [CONTINUOUS]
FX: BARRAGE STOPS.
What is this? Is your mind so empty?
(STUNNED) I know your Kastrian mind-reading tricks. I’ve learned how to resist them.
And are your friends so obdurate?
FX: BARRAGE OF PAIN HITS KATE.
GASPS
Leave her alone!
FX: BARRAGE STOPS.
She knows nothing of you. You are a stranger. She fears you.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 95

And the other?
Leave Nyssa alone! If you’re not Eldrad, then who are you and why are you causing chaos on the Earth?
I am Mulkris! The Executioner!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 96
47. INT. JEEP (IN MOTION
FX: TEGAN DRIVING.
No sign of your friend Charlie. I thought he’d be on our tail.
As long as you know the way back to Ambermouth.
I can read road signs, you know. (BEAT) But there’1ll be one heck of a row when we get back.
Why? Oho, Tegan, did you steal this car?
I told you, I borrowed it.
(LAUGHS) Tegan the joyrider?
(ANNOYED) I only did it to help you! (BEAT) How’s your arm?
Heavy.
The crystal’s up as far as your neck. We have to get you help.
(IN TURLOUGH’S HEAD) The Watcher, Turlough! Bring me the Watcher!
[INFLUENCED] I have... a mission.
If it’s anything to do with that dodgy mate of yours —
BEAT
[INFLUENCED] No! Mulkris orders that I deliver the Eye!
The [what-?]
FX: CAR HORN BLARES BEHIND THEM.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 97
Oh no. Your pal Charlie’s caught up with us.
[INFLUENCED] It isn’t important!
FX: HORN. WHEELS SCREECH AS CHARLIE GUNS CAR TOWARDS SIDE OF
JEEP.
What’s he playing at? He nearly hit us!
[INFLUENCED] Give me the wheel!
Are you insane-?
FX: WHEELS SCREECH. CAR SWERVES.
Turlough! Get off! You’re gonna drive us off the [road-!]
FX: BRAKES SCREECH AS CAR SLIDES OFF ROAD — THEN CRUNCH AS IT
STOPS IN A DITCH.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 98
48. EXT. FOREDECK
Pleased to meet you, Mulkris. I’m the Doctor, by the way. And these are my friends Nyssa and Kate.
What did he mean, ‘the Executioner’?
Whose Executioner?
Oh, I think I can guess.
Eldrad must die.
The thing is, you’re too late, Mulkris. Eldrad is already dead!
Dead! Ha! (BEAT) You are not of this world, Doctor. You cannot be, to know so much about our past.
No. I’m a Time Lord.
Ah.. A race of archivists and know-alls. But in this case, you are wrong! Eldrad’s body was shattered, but he was not eradicated. His remains were cast like seeds, out across the galaxy.
How very careless.
You think this was not his plan?!
So it’s your task to recover his body?
By the order of King Rokon, I left the devastation of Kastria to search thousands of worlds for the tyrant’s remains. Eldrad must die!
You’re too late. I told you. Eldrad’s gone. He’s already dead.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 99
He is on this world. A fragment of him still exists. An eye.
(SURPRISED) Don’t you mean a hand? A stone hand?
You know nothing! My agents are fetching Eldrad’s eye to me as we speak.
And would those agents include a boy named Turlough?
(GROANS) For “El Dorado” read ‘Eldrad’. (RE MULKRIS) Of course, you can control people’s minds-!
Eldrad cannot be dead, truly dead, until every particle of his being has been found and obliterated!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 100
49. INT. IN TURLOUGH’S HEAD: HEADMASTER’S OFFICE
DOCTOR/HEADMASTER
(SIGHS) Daydreaming again, Turlough? What a feeble boy you are. Time and again you’re given chances to redeem yourself, but always, always you let the school down.
Sir, it wasn’t my fault, sir. It was Gibbs, he was trying to drive us off the road-!
DOCTOR/HEADMASTER
Here we go again; always blaming other people.
So, at the next assembly, you’1ll be made to apologise in front of the whole school.
But, sir-!
DOCTOR/HEADMASTER No more excuses! Now get a move on. You’re already late for parade.
Parade-?
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL)

FX: SUDDENLY WE’RE OUT ON THE PARADE GROUND.
MARCHING IN THE DISTANCE.

were clear. Straight
Then get to it, Turlough! Wake up! Bring me the Eye so that

TEGAN AND TURLOUGH AFTER THEIR CRASH.

CONTROLLED) Eldrad.. shall... live! Yes! (STAGGERING AWAY
Eldrad... shall... live!

(MOROSE) It’s too late. My mission has failed. Every time, I bof a la

(ECHOING IN MULKRIS’ HEAD) Mulkris... Mulkris...!

FX: PULSE OF GENERATORS. DOOR HUMS OPEN. DOCTOR, NYSSA AND KATE

Isn’t it? Here, held in a stasis field, lie the gathered mortal, silicon remains of Eldrad, Architect and Destroyer of Kastria.

TEGAN AND TURLOUGH APPROACHING VILLAGE.
FX: A JEEP SHOOTS PAST.
(TO STOP) That’s the third army jeep we’ve seen heading for the village. Something’s up.

Eldrad, of course!

Forgive us, Mulkris. We came to admire your Eldrad collection.

Exactly. Just how many Eldrads do you want, Mulkris?
You should destroy them now.

Again?

What of it? I have slain a hundred false Eldrads on a hundred other worlds. He spreads through the Galaxy like a plague.
And now everything is running out of control again!
FX: HISSING, RATTLING OF THE BONES.

So Eldrad’s reign can begin again. You’re being used, Mulkris!

FX: SHE SETS OFF.

It’s not ice, see? It’s crystal. (STEPPING FORWARD) Still - seems solid enough. Shame we don’t have a sledge, though.

You reckon that arm of yours is just gonna sort itself out, you stay here. If you don’t — stop whingeing and come on!

FX: DISTANT SEAGULL. THE CRYSTALS ENROBING THE SHIP CRACKLE.
DOOR TO INSIDE OF ALEXANDER CREAKS OPEN. MULKRIS AND THE DOCTOR
OUT.
What is it you have to show me, Doctor?

(IN DENIAL) You lie, Doctor!
(APPROACHING FROM OFF) Mulkris..! Oh, Mulkris...!

Hello, Mulkris. Good to be back aboard the old Alexander.
Is it done? Have you brought it? Have you brought His Eye?
Right here. (TAPPING FOREHEAD) The Eye of Eldrad — see?
It’s lodged in his forehead. Mulkris, be careful.
(DISTURBED) What is this? Give the Eye to me.
It’s watching you, Executioner...

Give it to me, Gibbs! The Eye must take its place — confined with the other remnants! Eldrad must die!

BELLOWS AND CRASHES BACK
Mulkris!

FX: ELDRAD’S VOICE ECHOING IN NYSSA & KATE’S HEADS.
[PSYCHIC] Eldrad.. Eldrad...

Eldrad’s bones.

[PSYCHIC] Eldrad.. Eldrad!

(TAKEN OVER) It’s true, and you know it!
[PSYCHIC] Eldrad!

[PSYCHIC] Eldrad must live...
Yes!
DOUBLE, EVEN TRIPLE, BEAT.

& KATE And he must live again.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 118
59. EXT. QUARTZBERG
(STRUGGLING UP) Eldrad will not live.

FX: O’BRIEN RUNNING UP FROM OFF.
O’BRIEN Welcome back, Mr Gibbs, sir!

Already on it.
FX: CRACKLING OFF AS THE TARDIS BEGINS TO BE BROUGHT UP FROM

(STRUGGLING UP) I cannot lie here...!
FX: STOMPS TOWARDS DOOR OF ALEXANDER.

Aww, Mulkris, don’t go! You don’t want to miss this —

What are you plotting, Gibbs? You and Eldrad.

The crystals, they’re surging! There’s something rising out of the quartz!

FX: TARDIS PROPELLED OUT OF CRYSTAL FOUNTAIN, THUDS ONTO DECK.
SCATTERING.
My TARDIS!

No!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 120
60. EXT. FOREDECK
FX: NYSSA BLIPPING BUTTONS ON THE DOOR OF MULKRIS’S SHIP.

Three... integer seven... one... one...

DOCTOR: Really? That sort of energy isn’t easy to come by.
GIBBS: You reckon?
MULKRIS: (STRUGGLING UP) I cannot lie here...!
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 119
GIBBS: Aww, Mulkris, don’t go! You don’t want to miss this —
GIBBS: His loss.
DOCTOR: What are you plotting, Gibbs? You and Eldrad.
GIBBS: Look over the side, Doctor.
DOCTOR: The crystals, they’re surging! There’s something rising out of the quartz!
GIBBS: Just a little something to solve all our problems at a stroke. Mind out, there! —
CRYSTALS: SCATTERING.
DOCTOR: My TARDIS!
GIBBS: There’s power in that ship of yours, Doc. Lots and lots of lovely power. Just what Eldrad’s after.
DOCTOR: No!
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 120
BOTH: NYSSA AND KATE ARE POSSESSED.
NYSSA: Three... integer seven... one... one...
KATE: You must open the door. Eldrad must live.
NYSSA: Lattice keys are always difficult. But if I can bypass the recognition pad...
KATE: His bones do not rest easily.
NYSSA: Oh... why won’t the codes combine! Three... integer seven... one...
NYSSA: one...
ELDRAD: [PSYCHIC] Three... integer seven... zero... one... one...
NYSSA: Oh, yes... of course. Zero... one... one...
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 121
MANY: ELDRADS [PSYCHIC] (A WASH OF MANY VOICES, ALL SAYING:) Eldrad...
KATE: Here they lie. His remains. Quiet... quiet now...
NYSSA: They must be released. The gates must be opened.
NYSSA: & KATE Eldrad must [live].
KATE: Someone is coming.
NYSSA: Hide. In here.
MULKRIS: Who is here?
MULKRIS: Who disturbs the relics? BEAT.
MULKRIS: Or do you disturb yourselves?
MULKRIS: A STATIC-LADEN COMMUNICATION CHANNEL OPENS.
MULKRIS: This is Executioner Mulkris calling Kastria. Kastria from Mulkris. Make your response.
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 122
DOCTOR WHO: LADDER, ONTO DECK.
TEGAN: If this is an icebreaker, what’s it doing so far south?
TURLOUGH: You know this ship is nuclear-powered.
TEGAN: And?
TURLOUGH: These crystals are scrunching it up like a tin can. That can’t be good, [can it?]
GIBBS: (OFF, BEYOND OPEN DOOR) I want that ship of yours open. So hand over the key!
TEGAN: I know that voice!
TURLOUGH: Charlie Gibbs.
DOCTOR: (OFF, BEYOND OPEN DOOR) The TARDIS is off-limits, Gibbs!
TEGAN: And the Doctor. See, what’d I tell you?
TEGAN: What’s your mate doing to him?
GIBBS: (OFF, BEYOND OPEN DOOR) I won’t ask you again.
TEGAN: We’ve got to help him. Come on, Turlough. Don’t wimp out now.
TURLOUGH: We can’t just go charging in there! I’ve got a better idea...
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 123
DOCTOR: (REELING, PAINED) Is that you or Eldrad’s Eye talking? Because whoever you are, I won’t do it!
GIBBS: Fine. Okay. Not a problem. Don’t say I didn’t ask. Let him go, Captain!
GIBBS: O’BRIEN Sir.
DOCTOR: Oof!
GIBBS: Bit of lateral thinking, that’s what’s required. There’s always another way in.
DOCTOR: Crystal fragments. They’re moving!
GIBBS: Silicon dioxide, Doctor. Sand. Gets everywhere, doesn’t it? Like it has a life of its own.
DOCTOR: (SPITTING SAND) Get that stuff away from my TARDIS! Ugh!
GIBBS: In the sandwiches. Up the door.
DOCTOR: (CHOKING) Call it off! Ugh!
GIBBS: In and out the keyhole.
DOCTOR: It won’t work. The lock mechanism’s too complex!
GIBBS: Pop goes the weasel. (LAUGHS)
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 124
DOCTOR: Oh, very clever. But the ship won’t function without me!
GIBBS: Well, that’s easily fixed. —
GIBBS: What’s happening? Captain-?
GIBBS: O’BRIEN Fire alarm!
GIBBS: What-? Well, go and find out what the problem is, will you?
GIBBS: O’BRIEN Aye-aye, sir!
GIBBS: Now, Doctor. Where were — (HE’S GONE)
TEGAN: (OFF) C’mon, Doctor! Quick!
DOCTOR: (OFF) Thank you, Tegan.
TURLOUGH: (OFF) What’s the matter, Gibbo? Get distracted?
GIBBS: Oh, schoolboy trick, Turlers. Pathetic-! (CALLING) Captain! [Captain! ]
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 125
TURLOUGH: That’1l stall them for a minute.
DOCTOR: Tegan, Turlough. Good to see you both.
TEGAN: And you.
DOCTOR: Turlough. What happened to your arm?
TURLOUGH: I was hoping you’d tell me.
DOCTOR: Is it spreading?
TURLOUGH: Oh, yes.
TEGAN: Where’s Nyssa?
DOCTOR: She and Kate are on the foredeck.
TURLOUGH: What about Eldrad? Is he here?
DOCTOR: Don’t worry. Gibbs may have the TARDIS, but it’s Mulkris’s job to deal with Eldrad.
TEGAN: Mulkris?
DOCTOR: You two, stay close to the TARDIS. I’ve some bones to pick with them both.
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 126
MULKRIS: (DISTRESSED) Kastria from Mulkris. Kastria! Why do they not respond? Why?
NYSSA: & KATE Mulkris.
MULKRIS: What? — You. Is it true? Did you know? Is Kastria no more?
NYSSA: & KATE Listen to Eldrad. Eldrad must live.
MULKRIS: Eldrad must die! And so must his slaves!
DOCTOR: Mulkris! Finish your mission! Destroy the remnants! They’ve done enough damage!
MULKRIS: Doctor. Can it be? That Kastria is dead? Am I really alone?
DOCTOR: I’m sorry, Mulkris. But its memory endures.
MULKRIS: (HER CRY OF PAIN BECOMES A ROAR OF ANGER) Kastria!
GIBBS: (ENTERING, LAUGHING) But we shall start again, Executioner.
DOCTOR: Not you again-!
GIBBS: We will make a new Kastria in Eldrad’s image — won’t we, ladies?
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 127
NYSSA: & KATE Eldrad shall live and rule.
DOCTOR: Nyssa? Oh, good grief!
MULKRIS: Gibbs! Gibbs! I shall destroy you, Gibbs!
GIBBS: In your dreams, Mulkris!
MULKRIS: . with a dart of the poison that Eldrad himself created!
GIBBS: (FIGHTING BACK) No chance... Mulkris!
MULKRIS: (STRUGGLING) Eldrad must die!
GIBBS: (EFFORT) Not if I can turn the poison tip... on you!
DOCTOR: Mulkris!
MULKRIS: (DYING) Doctor?
DOCTOR: I’m here.
MULKRIS: Complete my mission... My ring...
DOCTOR: I understand. I promise.
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 128
ELDRAD: (BELLOWS WITH ECHOING LAUGHTER) See?
NYSSA: & KATE Eldrad lives.
GIBBS: And Mulkris dies.
DOCTOR: But not in vain. You see — she bequeathed her ring to me.
GIBBS: Stand away from the controls, Doctor.
DOCTOR: Mulkris’s genetic ring. (SETTING RING INTO CONTROL PANEL) I return it to her ship, so her task may be completed —
GIBBS: No!
DOCTOR: . and Eldrad’s last remains can be vaporised forever!
NYSSA: & KATE & GIBBS No!
NYSSA: VAPORISED.
ELDRAD: [PSYCHIC] (WHISPER) Eldrad...
LONG: BEAT.
NYSSA: (GASPS) Doctor? Is it over?
DOCTOR: Nyssa, you’re back. Not really, I’m afraid.
GIBBS: Eldrad’s bones may have been obliterated, but his Eye still lives. Soon, his crystals will surround the Earth!
KATE: Doctor? Is it true?
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 129
DOCTOR: Unless we find a way to stop them, yes.
GIBBS: (TRIUMPHANT) The Earth will become Eldrad, and Eldrad will become the Earth. Eldrad will live!
GIBBS: END OF PART THREE
DOCTOR WHO: ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 130

elements.text: PART FOUR
REPRISE:
Eldrad’s bones may have been obliterated, but his Eye still lives. Soon, his crystals will surround the Earth!
Doctor? Is it true?
Unless we find a way to stop them, yes.
(TRIUMPHANT) The Earth will become Eldrad, and Eldrad will become the Earth. Eldrad will live!
65. INT. MULKRIS’S SHUTTLE [CONTINUED]
No. The crystalline infection is nothing more than an aberration — an excrescent mutation with no mind of its own.
Eldrad’s mind is right here in my head, Doctor!
But you still need my TARDIS to regenerate him. You still need me.
Face it, Doctor — the old days are over. So get real. You could be a major player in Eldrad’s new Empire. He might even make you a General. Think of the rewards, eh?
If you think the Doctor would even consider [abandoning] —
Please, Nyssa.
Yeah, grown-ups talking. So, what do you say — Doctor?
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 131
66. EXT. QUARTZBERG/DECK
FX: DISTANT HELICOPTERS.
Look at that. The crystals have reached the village. The infection’s spreading faster now it’s hit the land.
It’s spreading faster on me, too! Where’ve the Doctor and Nyssa got to? And Gibbs — where’s he?
You’re not still sulking about your failed ‘mission’?
No. Funny, my mind seems clearer now. Like Mulkris isn’t there anymore.
FX: DOOR OPENS. DOCTOR EXITS.
(WALKING TO TARDIS, DELIBERATELY BRUSQUE) Tegan, Turlough?
Oh, at last!
The contamination on Turlough’s arm is spreading. He needs help.
FX: DOCTOR PUSHES TARDIS DOOR OPEN.
That can wait. Into the TARDIS!
We're leaving?
(LYING) I have a job to do for my new master.
Your what?
(OFF, AT DOOR) Eldrad, as they say, must live.
Mr Gibbs? Are you ready?
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 132
You bet. Eldrad’s getting impatient.
(TO DOCTOR) You’re not working with him!
(FOLLOWING GIBBS; FAKING) Do you have a better idea?
Not you, too!
(LYING) There’s no choice. Eldrad must be regenerated. And we can’t access the TARDIS power house without a full crew, can we?
But you can’t-
(COTTONING ON) Quiet, Turlough. Maybe the Doctor’s “right”?
Exactly (SHARP) So I expect absolute compliance from you all — understood?
Oh... right. Yes, sir.
It is for the best.
There’s work to do. Inside, all of you!
FX: THEY FILE INTO THE SHIP.
Captain O’Brien?
O’ BRIEN (COMING OVER FROM DOOR) Yes, Mr Gibbs?
You have your instructions.
O’BRIEN Phase two? Yes, sir. On standby. Eldrad must live.
Dead right, he must.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 133
(CALLING, AT TARDIS DOOR) We’re ready for you now, Mr Gibbs.
(GOING IN) And so is Eldrad.
FX: HE GOES IN. SIMULATANEOUSLY, KATE RUSHES ON DECK FROM
SHIP.
Nyssa, wait! You’re not really leaving, are you? All of you?
I’m sorry, Kate.
But I want to see.
No, not now.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 134
68. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
FX: TARDIS HUM
(LAUGHING) Oho... amazing. Incredible, Doctor. Eldrad is
impressed.
He’d better be.
FX: PULLS LEVER. DOORS CLOSE.
Doctor? What are you doing? Wait!
What I should have done at the start!
FX: TARDIS DEMAT SEQUENCE STARTS.
But what about Nyssa!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 135
69. EXT. DECK
FX: TARDIS DEMAT SEQUENCE
What’s that?
The TARDIS. Doctor, wait!
FX: THE SHIP VANISHES.
It’s gone. I don’t believe it. How did that happen?
Doctor!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 136
70. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM (IN FLIGHT
You’ve stranded Nyssa!
This ship is in flight?
(LYING) I’ve put the ship in a holding pattern, that’s all. Eldrad wants to survive. And I don’t want interruptions.
But Nyssa...
Nyssa will be there when we get back!
Let’s get started, shall we? The TARDIS powerhouse is directly below us.
No tricks, Doctor.
I find that faintly insulting. Through here please.
FX: THEY GO OUT.
Holding pattern, my foot. He’s taking us somewhere.
And what about Nyssa?
Right. Check the flight coordinates.
“Seven eight B. Reference six six seven three five.” Oh, this is no good. More than four dimensions and I’m lost.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 137
71. INT. TARDIS — BOILER ROOM
FX: DEEP PULSE OF TARDIS ENERGY. DISTANT CLANKS AND OTHER
SOUNDS.
(UNIMPRESSED) This is your ship’s powerhouse?
We should take Eldrad’s Eye from your forehead, Charlie. It can happily regenerate without you.
Nice try, Doc. But the Eye stays with me. Eldrad’s orders.
Then you’1ll need to wear a radiation suit for when I expose the core, or, well —
Forget the suit. I don’t expect to survive.
Does he really deserve such devotion? What are his plans?
First off, Eldrad armours the people of Earth. They’1l1 be strong — a new race of Titans. Fighters to take on the Galaxy.
(CONTEMPT) Just like he did on Kastria?
The Earth will be sheathed in living quartz. A fortress of impregnable adamantine. The heart of his new Imperial Army.
He can’t even control the crystal growth out there. It’s a shambolic mess.
It’s all in hand. Eldrad loves to make war. He lives for strategy and design.
Whether he wins or not?
Oh, he will triumph!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 138
72. EXT. QUARTZBERG/DECK
FX: DISTANT HELICOPTERS. HEAVY MACHINES TRUNDLED THROUGH.
O’BRIEN Keep clear, ladies, please. Heavy equipment coming through.
Those are missile launchers!
Captain? What’s happening?
O’BRIEN Orders from the top. Bombardment due to commence at oh-nine- hundred hours.
Bombardment? Who are you bombarding?
O’BRIEN Crystal seeding, miss. High-altitude detonation to seed the cloud systems.
But that’1ll precipitate the crystals worldwide.
Captain? You were working for Mulkris, until Gibbs turned Eldrad’s eye on you.
O’BRIEN New management, Miss. Mulkris was superseded. I serve Eldrad now. (SHOUTING) Okay. Bring them through!
(ASIDE) We have to warn someone, Nyssa!
(ASIDE) Or stop them. That’s what the Doctor would do.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 139
73. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
It was my task. Gibbs took over my mission.

Yeah, and if he hadn’t, you’d have ended up with a third eye slap-bang in the middle of your forehead! (BEAT) Wonder if the Doctor’s got any ideas how to get rid of those crystals yet? Cos if he doesn’t come up with something soon...
(ANNOYED) Yes, thank you for reminding me, Tegan!
I didn’t mean — oh, forget it.
What’s the matter?
It’s just.. I’ve got something nasty up my sleeve, too.
FX: SHE PULLS BACK HER SLEEVE.
Crystals. You’re being armoured. You too. Tegan, sorry. I
didn’t realise.
Yeah. Gets to all of us.
(LEAVING) Stay put. I’m going to find the Doctor.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 140
74. INT. TARDIS — BOILER ROOM
FX: DOCTOR TURNING POWER DIAL WITH SPANNER.
Hurry it up with that spanner, Doctor! Eldrad is waiting!
(STOPPING) Nearly there, Charlie. There’s just one small problem.
Which is what?
(HEFTING SPANNER) I can’t let you die. (EFFORT, HITS GIBBS WITH SPANNER)
What — (HIT)
FX: GIBBS FALLS TO FLOOR, UNCONSCIOUS.
Sorry about that. Mind you, your skull’s crystal-plated now, I can’t imagine I’1ll have done you much harm. Now (EFFORT) let’s see if I can’t get this Eye of off your forehead...
FX: EYE HUMS WITH POWER. JANGLE OF PAIN.
CRIES OUT
[PSYCHIC] (ECHOING IN DOCTOR’S HEAD) Time Lord!
(IN PAIN) Eldrad? Get out of my head!
[PSYCHIC] I should have chosen you as my servant! The Earthlings are pygmies by comparison!
Maybe I wasn’t available. Agh!
[PSYCHIC]
But we’ll soon drill them into an army. They have an inbred zeal for the fight and minds dull enough not to question orders! That’s a start! (LAUGHS)
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 141
[PSYCHIC] No wonder your people condemned you.
[PSYCHIC] Begin the regeneration sequence. Release the radiation.
Have you seen the mess you’ve making on Earth? Your crystal fortress is out of control.
[PSYCHIC] That can be remedied.
I doubt it. Not without... (REALISES HIS ERROR) Ah...
[PSYCHIC] Not without...? Not without what?! What are you hiding?
Nothing! Your mind-reading trick won’t work in here!
[PSYCHIC] So you can resist me.
I won’t let you regenerate, Eldrad. You won’t live again. Twice
is enough!
[PSYCHIC] Then my Eye shall sit on your head instead!
FX: EYE ‘JUMPS’ AT DOCTOR, AS BEFORE.
What-? Oh no —
FX: HE RUSHES OUT, INTO:
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 142
75. INT. TARDIS. CORRIDOR [CONTINUOUS]
(ARRIVING AS DOCTOR CHARGES OUT OF DOOR) Doctor? I thought you were [in —]
Turlough! Quick, keep clear of the Eye!
The Eye-?
FX: DOCTOR SLAMS DOOR SHUT, LOCKING EYE BEHIND. CLANG.
There, that should hold it. Is something the matter, Turlough?
You'd better come and see Tegan. She’s got crystals on her arm.
(SIGHS) Ah. Then that makes three of us.
Not you as well?
FX: BANGING ON THE DOOR.
(INSIDE) Doctor! Open the door!
That didn’t keep him down for long.
I thought you were taking him to the powerhouse, not the boiler
room?
So did he. Come on, we’ve more important things to do.
FX: THEY EXIT. BANGING ON THE DOOR.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL)
(INSIDE) Let me out! Doctor! Eldrad must live!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 144
76. EXT. QUARTZBERG/DECK
FX: MISSILE LAUNCHES, OFF.
How many more rockets do they have?
Can you hold the Geiger counter over here, please, Kate?
sorry.
FX: GEIGER COUNTER CLICKS VERY SLOWLY.
Hardly a thing. Not even normal background levels.
But the crystals need radiation to grow. That’s what the Doctor said.
Well, he’d know. (WORRYING) I’m sorry. I need to get back to the village.
Across the crystal sea? On your own?
My fish need feeding. And I have to find Jim. I think you should come too.
FX: NYSSA SNAPS OFF A CRYSTAL AND CRUNCHES IT.
These lattices are brittle. They’re growing too fast.
Oh... suppose they’ve absorbed all the radiation. And now they’re bolting, like weeds looking for sunlight.
FX: MISSILE LAUNCHES, OFF.
Sooner or later the crystal growth will start collapsing in on itself.
Those rockets are from the fighter jets that went missing, I bet you. They must have adapted them.
They can fire as many missiles as they like. In the end, it’ll make no difference.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 145
Come on. Back to the village.
Why are you so keen to leave, all of a sudden?
Because there’s nothing to be done! And because...
Kate?
Because of my arm.
FX: KATE PULLS BACK HER SLEEVE.
Satisfied?
The first symptoms of infection. I’m sorry.
FX: LIGHT PATTERING ON THE DECK.
Is that rain? No, not rain... It’s snowing.
It’s not snow either. Get under cover.
What?
They’re not ice crystals. It’s snowing quartz!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 146
77. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM (IN FLIGHT
FX: POWER HUM DIPS MOMENTARILY.
Hello. Now the power’s on the blink. (CALLS) Doctor!
FX: DOOR CLATTERS AS DOCTOR HURRIES IN, FOLLOWED BY TURLOUGH.
Just a blip, nothing to worry about.
There you are. What kept you?
Charlie Gibbs, who’s not happy at being locked in the boiler room.
Permanently, I hope. Doctor, did Turlough tell you —
I’m afraid all three of us have been infected.
Typical. The one of us you stranded was the trained medic.
FX: RUMMAGING THROUGH COATS ON COATSTAND.
Help me go through these coats, would you? I’m looking for a ring.
(TO TURLOUGH) Do you think it’s another symptom?
(TO TURLOUGH) Haven’t a clue.
A ring. Not unlike Mulkris’s. But belonging to Eldrad. I’m certain had it once, but now I can’t find it anywhere, which leads me to a rather worrying conclusion.
You’ve lost it.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 147
I might have left it on Kastria.
Is that a problem?
In one way, no. Because that’s where we’re going.
To Kastria!
It’s a cold, dead ruin of a place.
But on the other hand, we can’t have Eldrad’s Eye finding the ring — not if I want to maroon him there.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 148
78. INT. KASTRIA — ROYAL CHAMBER
FX: DISTANT HURRICANE.
OLD, MAD ELDRAD DRAGGING HIS HEAVY THRONE ALONG.
Hush, hush, my friends. Whisper not my name. Write it not in the dust. For I must live with it and die with it, and live again and again for all eternity.
Who do we blame? It was Him. He who cast us down!
FX: RATTLES A TIN.
Any change? (ROARS) Is there ever any change!
FX: DISTANT TARDIS ARRIVING.
What’s this? What disturbs our contemplation? Has the wind learned a new song?
Ah... or is it company at long, long last?
It is! We have visitors! (LAUGHS)
FX: SCRAPING HIS THRONE ALONG WITH GREAT EFFORT.
Come, my throne.
Places. Places, my friends, my subjects. (ANGRY) Let us be ready to welcome our guests!
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 149
79. INT. KASTRIAN DOME.
FX: WIND OUTSIDE. TEGAN WIPES A WINDOW.
What a place. It’s blowing a hurricane out there.
It’ll be warmer in the city below. We’ll just have a scout round...
Before you let Cheerful Charlie out?
Where’s Turlough?
He went to fetch something. He’s on edge. We all are.
Tegan, I will find a solution for you both, I promise.
And for you. It doesn’t hurt, does it? Just scratches a bit. Like being slowly wrapped in tin foil.
Canned in crystal armour? As part of the next Eldrad’s galactic army? That’s not going to happen.
I suppose if it came to it, you could regenerate yourself again.
Not if I have a choice. Where’s Turlough got to? We can’t wait all day.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 150
80. INT. TARDIS. CORRIDOR
FX: TURLOUGH TAPS AT THE DOOR.
Charlie? It’s me.
(THROUGH DOOR) Let me out, Turlough.
Just checking you’re okay.
Couldn’t resist, could you? Come on, open up.
The door stays locked. Sorry.
How’s your armour? It armours your mind too. You’1ll soon learn
to follow orders.
(UNEASY) Is that you talking? Or Eldrad’s Eye?
FX: WHUMPF! ELDRAD’S VOICE IS CLEAR IN TURLOUGH’S HEAD.
GASPS
[PSYCHIC] Follow orders, soldier. What are your orders?
Eldrad... Eldrad must live, sir!
[PSYCHIC] Then open the door. I am eager to come home.
Yes, sir.
FX: LOCK CLICKS, DOOR OPENS. GIBBS SAUNTERS OUT.
Nice one, Turlers. You carry on. And don’t forget — me and Eldrad, we're right behind you.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 151
81. INT. DOME
What’s he playing at? He’s taking too long. Turlough!
(BREATHLESS — POSSESSED BY ELDRAD) I’m here. Sorry I’m late,
sir.
Sir?
Are you okay? The crystals — they’ve reached your face.
(EMERGING) He’s fine. Aren’t you, Trooper Turlough?
(POSSESSED BY ELDRAD) Yes, sir!
Charlie Gibbs. You persuaded Turlough to let you out.
Eldrad ordered it. Turlough’s learned to obey.
(POSSESSED BY ELDRAD) All correct, sir. No problems, sir.
Oh, Turlough. I thought you were over that.
The armour’s coercing his thoughts. Soon he won’t have to for himself at all.
Will that happen to all of us?
If you’re in the infantry. Which is all he’s good for.
(POSSESSED BY ELDRAD) Sir! I’m content, sir!
That isn’t true!
think
Oh, you’re recruited too, sweetheart. Won’t be long now. And
you, Doc.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 152
Me,in Eldrad’s army? I don’t think so.
Talk to the Eye, Doctor. After the stunt you tried to pull, he’ll have you scrubbing the crystal latrines!
(LOOKING AROUND) Well, home at last. And there’s a ring to find... so I’m told.
Turlough, you didn’t!
(POSSESSED BY ELDRAD) Eldrad’s lost ring, sir.
And once we’ve found it...
You are not using my ship’s power to regenerate Eldrad!
When it comes to it, you won’t have a say in the matter.
ELDRAD MUST DIE! by Marc Platt (FINAL) 153
82. INT. SHIP’S RADIO ROOM
FX: WIND OUTSIDE
KATE AT RADIO DESK.
Anyone receiving? This is HMS Alexander. Over.
It’s a blizzard out there. You’1ll never reach the village now.
Still nothing. Oh well, we wait. (SHIVERS) Wait for orders to come through.
‘Orders ’...?
FX: DOOR CLATTERS OPEN AND SHUT.
O’BRIEN (STAMPING HIS BOOTS) Missile launch completed, ladies.
(POSSESSED BY ELDRAD) Eldrad must live, Captain!
Oh, no. Kate.
O’BRIEN Eldrad must live. What orders now?
